text: Zuriko Davitashvili (; born 15 February 2001) is a Georgian professional footballer who plays in Russia for Rotor Volgograd on loan from Rubin Kazan as an attacking midfielder. == Biography == === Club career === He made his career debut for FC Dinamo Tbilisi, on 29 September 2017 against FC Kolkheti Poti. He came on the pitch in the 72nd minute. In 2018, he moved to FC Locomotive Tbilisi. On 29 June 2019, he signed a 3-year contract with Russian Premier League club FC Rubin Kazan. He made his Russian Premier League debut for Rubin on 15 July 2019 in the season opener against FC Lokomotiv Moscow, as a starter. On 20 August 2020, he joined Rotor Volgograd on loan for the 2020–21 season. === International career === Before 2016, he played for Georgia national under-17 football team. After 2017, he played for Georgia national under-19 football team. He made his debut for Georgia national football team on 5 September 2019 in a friendly against South Korea, as a starter. == Honours == === Club === Georgia U-17 * Kazakhstan President Cup 2017 (Runner-up) === Individual === * Kazakhstan President Cup 2017, top scorer (6 goals) ==References== == External links == * * profile * * * Category:2001 births Category:Sportspeople from Tbilisi Category:Footballers from Georgia (country) Category:Association football midfielders Category:Georgia (country) youth international footballers Category:Georgia (country) under-21 international footballers Category:Georgia (country) international footballers Category:FC Dinamo Tbilisi players Category:FC Lokomotivi Tbilisi players Category:FC Rubin Kazan players Category:FC Rotor Volgograd players Category:Expatriate footballers from Georgia (country) Category:Expatriate footballers in Russia Category:Russian Premier League players Category:Living people
title: Zuriko Davitashvili
